001package imagingbook.lib.filter;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
004import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
005
006/**
007 * This (abstract) class represents a generic scalar filter whose pixel-operation
008 * is x/y-separable.
009 * It is similar to {@link GenericFilterScalar} but requires two methods to
010 * be implemented by concrete sub-classes: 
011 * {@link #doPixelX(PixelSlice, int, int)} and {@link #doPixelY(PixelSlice, int, int)}
012 * for the x- and y-pass, respectively,
013 * which are invoked in exactly this order.
014 * If the processed image has more than one component 
015 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
016 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
017 * The remaining filter mechanics
018 * including multiple components, out-of-bounds coordinate handling,
019 * multiple passes and data copying are handled by this class and its super-class
020 * (see {@link GenericFilter}). 
021 */
022public abstract class GenericFilterScalarSeparable extends GenericFilter {
023        
024        protected boolean doX = true;   // allow implementing sub-classes to deactivate x/y pass
025        protected boolean doY = true;
026        
027        // for progress reporting only
028        private int slice;
029        private int sliceMax = 1;
030        
031        private int iter = 0;
032        private int iterMax = 1;        // for progress reporting only
033        
034        
035        // apply filter to a stack of pixel planes (1 pass)
036        @Override
037        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
038                sliceMax = source.getDepth();
039                for (int k = 0; k < sliceMax; k++) {
040                        //IJ.log("+++++++ starting slice " + k);
041                        this.slice = k;
042                        runSlice(source.getSlice(k), target.getSlice(k));       // default behavior: apply filter to each plane, place results in target
043                }
044        }
045        
046        // a bit wasteful, as we provide a separate target for each plane
047        private void runSlice(PixelSlice source, PixelSlice target) {
048                final int width = source.getWidth();
049                final int height = source.getHeight();
050                this.iterMax = width * height * 2;
051                this.iter = 0;
052                
053                if (doX) {
054                        // IJ.log("doing X-part =============================== ");
055                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
056                                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
057                                        target.setVal(u, v, doPixelX(source, u, v));
058                                        this.iter++;
059                                }
060                        }
061                        target.copyTo(source);
062                }
063                
064                if (doY) {
065                        // IJ.log("doing Y-part =============================== ");
066                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
067                                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
068                                        target.setVal(u, v, doPixelY(source, u, v));
069                                        this.iter++;
070                                }
071                        }
072                }
073                
074                this.iter = 0;
075        }
076        
077        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
078
079        /**
080         * Applies a 1D filter operation in x-direction.
081         * This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
082         * This method is invoked before {@link #doPixelY(PixelSlice, int, int)}.
083         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelSlice} container, which
084         * holds the scalar values of one image component.
085         * The method {@link PixelSlice#getVal(int, int)} should be used to read
086         * individual pixel values. These data should not be modified but
087         * the (float) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
088         * 
089         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
090         * @param u the current x-position
091         * @param v the current y-position
092         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
093         */
094        protected abstract float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
095
096        /**
097         * Applies a 1D filter operation in y-direction.
098         * This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes.
099         * This method is invoked after {@link #doPixelX(PixelSlice, int, int)}.
100         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelSlice} container, which
101         * holds the scalar values of one image component.
102         * The method {@link PixelSlice#getVal(int, int)} should be used to read
103         * individual pixel values. These data should not be modified but
104         * the (float) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
105         * 
106         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
107         * @param u the current x-position
108         * @param v the current y-position
109         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
110         */
111        protected abstract float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
112        
113        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
114        
115        @Override
116        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
117                double loopProgress = (this.iter + subProgress) / this.iterMax;
118                //IJ.log("   loopProgress = " + loopProgress);
119                double sliceProgress = (this.slice + loopProgress) / this.sliceMax;
120                //IJ.log("   sliceProgress = " + sliceProgress);
121                //System.out.println("reportProgress: GenericFilterScalar " + localProgress);
122                return super.reportProgress(sliceProgress);
123        }
124
125        
126}
